Explanations about Options.--cpu-list(M):
Interpret mask as numerical list of processors instead of a bitmask. Numbers are
 separated by commas and may include ranges. For example: 0,5,8-11.
Explanations about Options.--pid(M): Operate on an existing PID and do not launch a new task.
Explanations about Options.-c(C): As a workaround, you could use "taskset -c -p 0 $PID" for all other processes to force them to run on CPU #0 only.

 separated by commas and may include ranges. For example: 0,5,8-11.
Explanations about Options.-p(M): Operate on an existing PID and do not launch a new task.
